1.name: My Man Godfrey
1.description: A scatterbrained socialite hires a vagrant as a family butler - but there's more to Godfrey than meets the eye.

2.name: Modern Times
2.description: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

3.name: Fury
3.description: When a wrongly accused prisoner barely survives a lynch mob attack and is presumed dead, he vindictively decides to fake his death and frame the mob for his supposed murder.

4.name: Things to Come
4.description: The story of a century: a decades-long second World War leaves plague and anarchy, then a rational state rebuilds civilization and attempts space travel.

5.name: Flash Gordon
5.description: Flash Gordon, Dale Arden and Dr. Alexis Zarkov visit the planet Mongo to thwart the evil schemes of Emperor Ming the Merciless, who has set his planet on a collision course with Earth.

6.name: Camille
6.description: A Parisian courtesan must choose between the young man who loves her and the callous baron who wants her, even as her own health begins to fail.

7.name: The Last of the Mohicans
7.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

8.name: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
8.description: A simple, small town man inherits a massive fortune, making him the target for scammers and publicity-seekers. Overwhelmed by the turn his life has taken, and awoken to another use for his new-found fortune, he makes a momentous decision.

9.name: Sabotage
9.description: A Scotland Yard undercover detective is on the trail of a saboteur who is part of a plot to set off a bomb in London. But when the detective's cover is blown, the plot begins to unravel.

10.name: Swing Time
10.description: A performer and gambler travels to New York City to raise the $25,000 he needs to marry his fiancée, only to become entangled with a beautiful aspiring dancer.

11.name: The Great Ziegfeld
11.description: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., famed producer of extravagant stage revues, are portrayed.

12.name: The Petrified Forest
12.description: A waitress, a hobo and a bank robber get mixed up at a lonely diner in the desert.

13.name: Born to Dance
13.description: Sailor Ted meets at the Lonely Hearts Club of his friend Gunny's wife, Jenny, a girl, Nora Paige, and falls in love. Nora wants to become a dancer on Broadway. Ted rescues the Pekinese of ...                See full summary »

14.name: Tell Your Children
14.description: Cautionary tale features a fictionalized take on the use of marijuana. A trio of drug dealers lead innocent teenagers to become addicted to "reefer" cigarettes by holding wild parties with jazz music.

15.name: Poor Little Rich Girl
15.description: The daughter of a wealthy businessman becomes lost in the city while traveling to a new school, and is taken in by a pair of down-on-their-luck performers.

16.name: Secret Agent
16.description: After three British Agents are assigned to assassinate a mysterious German spy during World War I, two of them become ambivalent when their duty to the mission conflicts with their consciences.

17.name: Dodsworth
17.description: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.

18.name: After the Thin Man
18.description: Nick investigates the case of a missing man and later a murder that is connected to Nora's family.

19.name: Show Boat
19.description: Despite her mother's objections, the naive young daughter of a show boat captain is thrust into the limelight as the company's new leading lady.

20.name: Dracula's Daughter
20.description: Hungarian countess Marya Zaleska seeks the aid of a noted psychiatrist, hoping to free herself of a mysterious evil influence.

21.name: San Francisco
21.description: A Barbary Coast saloonkeeper and a Nob Hill impresario are rivals for the affections of a beautiful singer, both personally and professionally in 1906 San Francisco.

22.name: The Story of Louis Pasteur
22.description: The biography of the pioneering French microbiologist who helped revolutionize agriculture and medicine.

23.name: Libeled Lady
23.description: A newspaper man, his ignored fiancée, and his former employee, a down on his luck reporter, hatch an elaborate scheme to turn a false news story into the truth in order to prevent a high-society woman from suing for libel.

24.name: The Charge of the Light Brigade
24.description: A major countermands orders and attacks to avenge a previous massacre of men, women, and children.

25.name: Romeo and Juliet
25.description: Young love is poisoned by a generations long feud between two noble families.

26.name: Three Smart Girls
26.description: Three sisters scheme to reunite their divorced parents before their wealthy father marries a conniving gold digger.

27.name: These Three
27.description: Two school teachers and the man they both love face ruin when a malicious student cooks up a lie.

28.name: Pigskin Parade
28.description: Married coaches Slug and Bessie find hillbilly football tosser Amos and the team gets invited to the Yale Bowl.

29.name: Anthony Adverse
29.description: In 18th-century Italy, an orphan's debt to the man who raised him threatens to separate him forever from the woman he loves.

30.name: Follow the Fleet
30.description: A Navy sailor tries to rekindle a romance with the woman he loves while on liberty in San Francisco.

31.name: Winds of the Wasteland
31.description: The arrival of the telegraph put Pony Express riders like John Blair and his pal Smoky out of work. A race will decide whether they or stageline owner Drake get the government mail contract.

32.name: The Invisible Ray
32.description: A scientist becomes murderous after discovering, and being exposed to the radiation of, a powerful new element called Radium X.

33.name: Three Godfathers
33.description: Four outlaws come to New Jerusalem, a town full of courteous and religious people, to rob the bank. After shooting the president of the bank, only three make it out of town followed by the ...                See full summary »

34.name: Come and Get It
34.description: An ambitious lumberjack abandons his saloon girl lover so that he can marry into wealth, but years later becomes infatuated with the woman's daughter.

35.name: Stowaway
35.description: A young girl lost in Shanghai is taken in by an American playboy and his girlfriend.

36.name: The Garden of Allah
36.description: The star-crossed desert romance of a cloistered woman and a renegade monk.

37.name: Little Lord Fauntleroy
37.description: An American boy turns out to be the long-lost heir of a British fortune. He is sent to live with the cold and unsentimental lord who oversees the trust.

38.name: The Trail of the Lonesome Pine
38.description: A railroad man from the city befriends a mountain girl in a Kentucky family feud.

39.name: Anything Goes
39.description: A young man falls in love with a beautiful blonde. When he sees her being forced onto a luxury liner, he decides to follow and rescue her. However, he discovers that she is an English ...                See full summary »

40.name: Mary of Scotland
40.description: The recently widowed Mary Stuart returns to Scotland to reclaim her throne but is opposed by her half-brother and her own Scottish lords.

41.name: The Walking Dead
41.description: After hapless pianist and ex-con John Elman is framed for murder, he is resurrected by a scientist after his execution.

42.name: Lloyds of London
42.description: Blake is in love with an aristocratic woman whose husband seriously injures him. Blake's friendship with Lord Nelson provides the basis for Blake's part in the growth of Lloyd's insurance ...                See full summary »

43.name: Captain January
43.description: A little girl named Star lives with a lighthouse keeper who rescued her when her parents drowned. A truant officer decides she should go to boarding school but she's rescued by relatives.

44.name: Wife vs. Secretary
44.description: The wife of a publishing executive mistakenly believes that her husband's relationship with his attractive secretary is more than professional.

45.name: Theodora Goes Wild
45.description: The author of a controversially racy best-selling book tries to hide her celebrity status from her provincial small-town neighbors, who'd be scandalized if they knew.

46.name: Charlie Chan's Secret
46.description: The heir to a huge fortune is presumed drowned, then shows up, is then murdered.

47.name: The Amazing Quest of Ernest Bliss
47.description: A bored millionaire wagers his doctor that he can support himself at a working class job for year without touching his inheritance.

48.name: Suzy
48.description: Believing a German spy has killed her new husband, a struggling chorus girl flees to Paris where she meets and marries a World War I pilot, whose carefree ways brings about unexpected results.

49.name: Bullets or Ballots
49.description: After Police Captain Dan McLaren becomes police commissioner former detective Johnny Blake knocks him down convincing rackets boss Al Kruger that Blake is sincere in his effort to join the ...                See full summary »

50.name: Satan Met a Lady
50.description: A double-crossing woman, the two-timing P.I. she hired, the corpulent "empress of crime", and a gentleman thief are all after a legendary priceless eighth-century ram's horn.
